showScoreExcerpt:
Shucked is a beautiful experiment bringing back the idea that there’s no reason why going to the theatre can’t be, as once it was, a fun indulgence for the groundlings instead of a sophisticated activity that only appeals to an upper class demographic. The book evokes guffaws, and the score is incredibly complex, beautiful, and well thought out- many of these ideas are surprisingly serious. What contradictions do we laugh at, instead of question? Shucked made me think more than I expected to. A+
